summary: The Korematsu-Takai Civil Liberties Protection Act of 2025 aims to protect individuals in the United States from unlawful detention based solely on protected characteristics. The bill amends Title 18 of the United States Code to prohibit imprisonment or detention based on factors like race, ethnicity, national origin, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and disability. The bill also empowers the Attorney General to designate additional protected characteristics, but prohibits the removal of those specifically listed.
